description: Erection of rear dormer window and installation of rooflights on front roof slope.
decision_conditions: Prior to occupation a minimum of one bird or bat nesting box shall be installed just below eaves level on an unobstructed elevation and retained permanently like so. REASON: In the interests of biodiversity.
The front roof lights hereby approved shall be conservation style and flush with the roof slope.REASON: To preserve the character and appearance of the conservation area.

Prior to occupation a minimum of one bird or bat box shall be provided just below eaves level on an unobstructed elevation with a clear flight path and shall be retained for the lifetime of the development. REASON: In the interests of biodiversity.

<p>Full details, with samples, of the materials to be used on the external surfaces of the buildings, including glazing, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority in writing before any work on the site is commenced. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and appearance of the conservation area.</p>

Notwithstanding the details shown on the drawings hereby approved, detailed drawings showing the following modification(s) to the scheme must be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, in writing, before any work is commenced:


a) 4-over-4 timber sash windows. 


The development may only be undertaken in accordance with the modifications thus approved and retained thereafter.


REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and appearance of the conservation area.

All new external finishes in respect of all the works hereby approved (and any other incidental works to be carried out in this connection) shall match the existing building in respect of materials used, detailed execution and finished appearance.


REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and appearance of the conservation area.

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
